title: Where the Wild Things Rock / A Day at the Beach with Picasso / The King Who Stole
description: Rockology's Third version that is no longer available. The current version is Sixth (please check All Editions below for more information).This Amazon.com kindle book contains three fully illustrated stories by Jeff Hopp.In the first story, 'Where the Wild Things Rock', Alex is sent to bed without supper and ends up taking his private limo to a far-off world inhabited by rock and roll legends - Jimi Hendrix, Elvis Presley, Jim Morrison, Janis Joplin, Mick Jagger, Jimmy Page and Ozzie Osbourne are just a few of the world's greatest rock stars who crown Alex as the leader of their band that headlines the greatest rock show of all time. 'Where the Wild Things Rock' is a rock and roll parody of the classic children's book 'Where the Wild Things Are' by Maurice Sendak.The second story is 'A Day at the Beach with Picasso'. This illustrated poem was inspired by Ray Bradbury's short story 'In a Season of Calm Weather' and stars Pablo Picasso creating his masterpieces on a sandy beach.The third story is 'The King Who Stole the Universe' and is a tale of an evil king who is stealing the universe by tricking planets into selling him their sun. This story was inspired by a Frank Marino and Mahogany Rush's song 'King Who Stole (...the Universe) from his 1975 album Strange Universe.
author: Jeff  Hopp
